author: Alex Michaelides
review: A gripping psychological thriller that delves into the complexities of the human mind. The plot twists will keep you hooked until the very end.

author: Delia Owens
review: A beautiful, haunting story of survival and solitude in the swamps of North Carolina. A heartfelt, unforgettable journey into the heart of nature and humanity.

author: Tara Westover
review: An incredible memoir of resilience, showing how Tara overcame a strict, isolated upbringing to earn a Ph.D. from Cambridge University. An inspiring and emotional read.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A classic tale of love, wealth, and the American Dream, set in the Jazz Age. Fitzgerald's sharp commentary on society and human ambition still resonates today.

author: James Clear
review: A practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones. Clearâ€™s methodical approach makes habit formation more achievable and helps readers optimize their lives.

bookName: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
review: A thought-provoking exploration of the history of humankind, from the Stone Age to modern society. Harari's insights into human evolution are both enlightening and engaging.
